column4: Does anyone know why when I put my computer into hibernation, every time I turn it back on it doesn't act like it's coming out of hibernation, but instead just reboots?
by entering dmesg > dmesg.txt and putting dmesg.txt somewhere on a pastebin or similar
=112 ID=6527 DF PROTO=TCP SPT=48270 DPT=41567 WINDOW=16755 RES=0x00 ACK URGP=0
the kernel's ringbuffer is already eaten up by iptables output as it seems
capture the dmesg output immediately after the misbehaved reboot
You know what, when I just did it it worked.
It seems this only happens when my cpmputer is in hibernation for extended periods (like 10 mins or more).
I'm unsure if you are reading this or if I am stiill muted..
open top in a terminal, press F for sorting mode and then n for sort-by-memory-usage
But I cannot read it unfortunately.
ah, yes.  system monitor is probably more gnome integrated :-)
